website_summaries.verdict: The Nikon Coolpix S220 is an adequate, inexpensive choice for social-network-loving photographers.
pros: very good features for its class

customer_reviews.title: A Good Camera
customer_reviews.text: I had this camera since 2011, and recently, the focus quit working. Since I had all the accessories and liked the camera, I bought a used replacement which works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this one to replace the one we've had for years that went on the fritz. Works great for us.
customer_reviews.author: Xpistols

customer_reviews.title: "Like New"?
customer_reviews.text: This camera was advertised as being in "like new" condition. In reality, it appears that this camera has had a very rough life. There are dings and scratches everywhere. However, it does work, and it came with a battery and a charger. It was probably worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Carl A. Mcneece

customer_reviews.title: Great travel camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera mainly for it's compactness.And it fill that bill very well,plus it has lot of features that are real nice.The only down side is picture quality is a little off.But I have other cameras for that.It's great for spontanious picture taking.
customer_reviews.author: C. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Little Nikon digital camera
customer_reviews.text: About the smallest of the popular no frills, easy to use point and shoot digital camera. Nikon quality throughout. You might like a larger zoom, or a bigger LCD, but for around $100, you cannot complain.
customer_reviews.author: salukimike

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera.
customer_reviews.text: What to say....this is the 3rd one I have purchased. 1 for daughter, 1 for wife, 1 for myself. Got a great price through Amazon on all 3 every time I ordered. If you get one, make sure you get a memory card and screen protector right away. Camera internal memory is next to nothing and the screen does scratch easily. I have 4gb cards in all 3.
customer_reviews.author: R. M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Nice Package, Crumby Optics
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for the times when I don't have a lot of space and need a camera to slip into a shirt or jacket pocket. It fits my pockets very well. But so do a myriad of other cameras. This is my first Nikon product and probably will be my last. I purchased it because of the reputation of the Nikon brand. Unfortunately, this camera does not live up to that reputation. The images it produces are terrible. I returned the camera. Fortunately, I purchased the camera from Amazon so the return was almost effortless.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Alexander

customer_reviews.title: A camera thats easy to use
customer_reviews.text: A great item and looking for of a camera with accessories for the unit. Still have it after all these years
customer_reviews.author: daniel robles

customer_reviews.title: NIkon Coolpix -Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for the price, loads of features and settings. Takes great pictures. I love the battery charger- it lasts so long so you don't miss any photo opportunities
customer_reviews.author: R. Sigel

customer_reviews.title: Good Camaera
customer_reviews.text: The camara performs as advertised. I have taken several pictures since my purchase and all have turned out great. I am also very pleased with Amazon.com. Each time iv purchased with Amazon, I have not been disappointed with my order nor with the excellent service. JLove
customer_reviews.author: James Love

customer_reviews.title: Overall Just Okay
customer_reviews.text: I don't have much to say because I didn't have high expectations. I was looking for a coolpix to replace the one I previously had. However, I definitely liked my older model better, despite the new one's sleek, modern look. It's less user friendly making the various settings harder to switch. Also the camera's lcd screen has poor quality. When the pictures are loaded onto your computer they look okay, but when you're taking the picture there are green spots and people are a bit washed out. It works fine for me because I only wanted to cheap point and shoot to carry around with me wherever I go, but I wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: The Nikon Coolpix is a good camera but I feel the pictures aren't as good as other camera's. A couple of years ago I bought a Kodak camera for around $90 and I feel the pictures were superior to this camera.
customer_reviews.author: V. Faller

customer_reviews.title: Just as expected
customer_reviews.text: Camera arrived timely & in perfect shape. It was for my daughter & she is very pleased with the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Claire Boldrick

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Got this as an X-mas gift. I upgraded to the Canon T1I which was much more suitable for me. Do not like!
customer_reviews.author: James Blinn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! It works so great and the picture quality is amazing! My favorite part is being able to crop the pictures to make new pictures!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Whitney

customer_reviews.title: slippery little thing
customer_reviews.text: The USB connector won't work on the recepticles on the front of a computer, you have to plug it in one on the back. Plus this thing is really slippery, watch you don't drop it. It takes adequate pictures.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Greene

customer_reviews.title: Poor pictures and video
customer_reviews.text: You can find better cameras than this camera for the price. If you don't care at all about the picture and video quality. Just like the portability and design and doesn't care for value. This is the camera for you! For everyone else you can find a much better camera. Pros Easy to use it takes pictures slim nice design cons horrible image quality! horrible video quality! I didn't have time to test the battery life though. Since right when I turned it on I didn't like it. I gave it chance by changing the settings but nothing worked. I used it for an hour then returned it. I'm now looking for another camera.
customer_reviews.author: alb304

customer_reviews.title: terrible!  broke after 2 months!!  nikon refused to repair.
customer_reviews.text: "I would not recommend this camera to any1. When I shut the camera off, it retracted off-track. I couldnt figure out why this occurred. I contacted Nikon, and sent the camera in for warranty repairs since I only had it for 2 months. nikon told me it wasnt covered undered warrant as the "front lens sustained an impact". It clearly did not!! they wanted $110 to repair it... I would not recommend this camera or any nikon to anyone. Seems like this is a common issue w Nikon, that they refuse to warranty. great job nikon. best buy reviews confirm that others are having this problem. terrible service & camera here from nikon. i regret my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Biggest Piece of Junk Ever......
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst camera i have ever bought! I felt like i was taking care of a new born baby! It breaks with the slightest TOUCH of the screen. Even with a carrying case this piece of junk breaks somehow in the case. Im going to invest in a canon or something not made to sit on a desk. I would not recommend this camera to anyone who actually gets out of the house. I went through 3 after the third return i just got a Cannon. Seriously dont buy this save your self SO much stress and trouble. Go for another company!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Neal

customer_reviews.title: Cute, Portable, and Easy to Use!!
customer_reviews.text: What a joy to find a camera that is so small that it fits in your pocket or pocketbook but takes great pictures! It is so easy to connect to charge the battery by simply plugging in a power cord. Comes with a USB connector cord for downloading pictures making it a breeze! I love how easy it is to program this camera - simple instructions and easy to understand icons to remind you of what to do. I will never go big and bulky again!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Seaturtle

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Indoor Photos
customer_reviews.text: I have had many digital cameras in the past 10 years and I have to say this is the worst camera I've ever had. It takes awful indoor photos. The flash is not strong enough and every single indoor photo is blurry and/or yellow in color. I've called Nikon and made sure all my setting were the factory defaults and I've tried using all the different flash options but nothing really seems to help. VERY disappointed in this camera.
customer_reviews.author: sllimbo

customer_reviews.title: A good little camera at a good little price!
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted an inexpensive, very small camera that will fit in my pocket. Nothing fancy, just basically a "point and shoot" variety. The Nikon Coolpix S220 really fits my specs beautifully. I am not very electronically savvy, yet I had no trouble learning how to use it. I recommend, though, getting a neck lanyard so that you can carry it around your neck - this would make it less likely for you to lose or drop it somewhere. My only complaint - and it's just a very tiny one - is that without the view finder feature that other cameras have, it is often hard to see the image you're photographing if it is a bright clear day.
customer_reviews.author: Godmother of the Bride

customer_reviews.title: Terrible photos.  Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my girlfriend for Christmas this year. I purchased the Tuesday before Thanksgiving and decided to take it home for the holiday to test it out. It is small and easy enough to use, but the photo quality is absolutely terrible. I tested it in a variety of situations: inside, outside, bright light, low light, and even shot some video. I would say it failed every category. The photo quality is perhaps a step above a cellphone camera (but not by much) in my opinion. I returned it on Black Friday and purchased a Canon SD 1200 IS. It unfortunately cost me about $30 more, but I think it will end up being worth it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Coolpix S220 avoid at all costs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera over the summer thinking it was going to take some nice pictures while visting Italy. Overall, I was extremely disappointed with the picture quality especially when taking pictures inside the museums and night shots. Inside the museum, the pictures came out grainy and I noticed the camera couldn't take decent pictures at night. Night pictures looked blurry and out of focus. I orginally paid 149.99 for this camera and then resold it taking a loss of 69 dollars. Avoid this camera at all costs. I'll stick to Cannon or Sony for my next camera purchase. I'll think twice about purchasing a Nikon again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Olivera

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works wonderful. There are still some photos on it though. But no worries I'll handle it.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney MORRIS

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this camera was decent based on other reviews, but after owning it for a while it is really sub-par. Save your money for something else. It just does not work correctly or as indicated. It takes ok video, but the pictures are not very good quality and it's impossible to force changes to some picture settings, particularly night. I get better pictures from my 3 megapixel cell phone!!! Can't believe I wasted my money on this POS.
customer_reviews.author: Dresch

customer_reviews.title: Nikon's Big Joke
customer_reviews.text: This camera is so bad, I can't believe it hasn't been pulled from the shelves. I work with digital cameras and wouldn't give this to my worst enemy. Buy the Canon SD780 or SD1200 IS instead. They actually take great pictures!
customer_reviews.author: Brent Paxton

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Camera
customer_reviews.text: Was not very happy to find that this camera didn't have A memory chip or carrying case as the one did, my son bought at Costco for the same money.
customer_reviews.author: Larry L. Blackett

product_meta.title: Nikon Coolpix S220 10MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom and 2.5 inch LCD (Graphite Black)
product_meta.description:
Color:Graphite BlackFROM THE MANUFACTURER


Nikon’s ultra slim, stylish Coolpix S220 combines 10.0 effective megapixels with a 3x optical Zoom-Nikkor glass lens for stunning prints as large as 16x20 inches. The sleek, all-metal design slips right in your shirt pocket or purse, and the incredible, bright 2.5-inch LCD makes it easy to compose and share pictures even in bright sunlight. The Coolpix S220, with Nikon’s EXPEED image processor and new 4-Way Image Stabilization, enables you to take incredible pictures, and Nikon’s new Smart Portrait System combines automatic in-camera features that enable users to get great portraits of smiling faces without red-eye and blink. 

Coolpix S220 Highlights 

10.0-megapixel resolution for stunning prints as large as 16 x 20 inches 

3x optical Zoom-Nikkor glass lens provides exceptional pictures and gets you close to the action 

New EXPEED image processor ensures high-quality pictures with stunning color and sharpness 

4-Way VR Image stabilization

 * Nikon’s Electronic VR image stabilization compensates for the effects of camera shake by adjusting the shutter speed and the ISO to get the optimal results 
 * Motion Detection automatically detects moving subjects and adjusts shutter speed and the ISO setting to compensate for cameras hake and subject movement 
 * High ISO up to 2000 capability helps give you sharper results when shooting in low light or capturing fast-moving subjects. 
 * Nikon’s original Best Shot Selector (BSS) automatically takes up to 10 shots while the shutter is pressed and saves the sharpest image 

Bright 2.5-inch high-resolution LCD makes it easy to compose and share your pictures 

Scene Auto Selector automatically recognizes the scene in your picture and adjusts camera setting 

Nikon’s Smart Portrait System:  * Smile Mode The camera automatically takes the shot when the subject smiles 
 * Blink proof camera automatically takes two shots and saves the one in which the subject’s eye are open 
 * In-Camera Red-Eye Fix automatically fixes most instances of red-eye in the camera. You may never see red-eye again 
 * Improved Face-Priority AF - Nikon’s face-finding technology that automatically focuses on faces faster than ever. Up to 12 faces can be detected and Face priority AE adjusts brightness of the subject’s face 
 * D-Lighting rescues dark or backlit images by improving brightness and detail where needed
feature_bullets: 10.0-megapixel resolution for photo-quality prints up to 16 x 20 inches
3x optical Zoom-Nikkor glass lens; 4-way VR image stabilization
Nikon's Smart Portrait System; Red-eye Fix, Face Priority AE and more
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars45 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
